Chemical.content:
Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Ionizing radiation is capable of inducing the requisite CML - associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome ) in appropriate cells in vitro but , thus far , chemicals have not shown this capacity .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Ionizing radiation |
| CML-associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome ) |

Note: In this context, "ionizing radiation" is the chemical entity that emits ions or electrons when passing through a material, leading to ionization. "CML-associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome )" is a specific chromosomal abnormality, but it is mentioned as a result of the interaction with ionizing radiation, so it is included as a chemical entity in this context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| Ionizing radiation |
| CML-associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome ) |

Note: In this context, "ionizing radiation" is a form of radiation that is capable of ionizing atoms or molecules, and "CML-associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome )" is a specific chromosomal abnormality that can be induced by ionizing radiation. Both are chemical entities in this context.
